text: Robert Douglas Benton (September 29, 1932 â€“ May 11, 2025) was an American movie director and screenwriter. He was known for his work in Bonnie and Clyde. He was nominated for an Academy Award for this. In 1979, he wrote and directed the movie Kramer vs. Kramer, winning the Academy Award for Best Director and the Academy Award for Best Adapted Screenplay. He later won a third Academy Award for Best Original Screenplay for the movie Places in the Heart (1984).
